column4: Hey all - I've installed a package from a .deb which is also available from the repos as a newer version, hence apt-get upgrade shows it as requiring an update. How would I go about telling apt-get to ignore this?
I've tried dpkg --set-selections, but it hasn't seemed to have worked
echo "packagename hold" | sudo dpkg --set-selections # Should work.
ah right it has worked, it just still shows up, thanks
